references.paper_title: The gap between theory and practice in function approximation with deep neural networks
references.reason: This paper establishes a theoretical foundation for the use of deep neural networks in function approximation, which is crucial for understanding the results of this paper.

references.paper_title: Deep neural networks are effective at learning high-dimensional Hilbert-valued functions from limited data
references.reason: This paper demonstrates the effectiveness of deep neural networks in learning high-dimensional functions, providing a benchmark for assessing the performance of the methods presented in this paper.

references.paper_title: Optimal approximation of infinite-dimensional holomorphic functions II: recovery from i.i.d. pointwise samples
references.reason: This paper extends the theory of approximating holomorphic functions, which is highly relevant for the holomorphic operators considered in this paper.

references.paper_title: Near-optimal learning of Banach-valued, high-dimensional functions via deep neural networks
references.reason: This paper provides a theoretical analysis for learning Banach-valued functions, a key class of functions considered in the present work.

references.paper_title: Learning smooth functions in high dimensions: from sparse polynomials to deep neural networks
references.reason: This paper bridges the gap between sparse polynomial approximation and deep neural networks, providing a valuable theoretical framework for the current work.
